title: Sports-no-CBC
text:
Quarterback Jared Goff has agreed to a four-year contract extension with the Los Angeles Rams through the 2024 season.

The Rams confirmed the agreement Tuesday night. The team didn't disclose contract terms, but ESPN reported it was for $134 million US, with $110 million guaranteed.

Goff is beginning his fourth year with the Rams, who made him the No. 1 overall pick in the 2016 draft. After a rocky rookie season, Goff has become a two-time Pro Bowl selection under coach Sean McVay over the past two years.

Goff has passed for 8,492 yards with 60 touchdowns and 19 interceptions in 31 regular-season games as McVay's starter. He also led the Rams to two playoff victories before the Super Bowl, where he struggled in a 19-for-38 performance for 229 yards in Los Angeles' 13-3 loss.

Even after Carson Wentz, the No. 2 pick behind Goff in the 2016 draft, got a $128 million extension from the Eagles in June, Goff said he had no concerns about entering his fourth season without a new deal. Now he won't have to.

Goff is making about $4.3 million this season before his pay is scheduled to jump to $22.8 million in 2020.
description: Quarterback Jared Goff has agreed to a four-year contract extension with the Los Angeles Rams through the 2024 season.
